newsitem.title: USA: Teltrend sees Q4 sales near Q3's $21.3 mln.
newsitem.headline: Teltrend sees Q4 sales near Q3's $21.3 mln.

text.p: Teltrend Inc said Thursday it expects to post fiscal fourth quarter revenues close to the $21.3 million reported for the third quarter ended April 26.

"Based upon current run rates and indications from our customers, our present expectation is that sales for the fourth quarter will likely be about level with those of our recently completed third quarter," Teltrend chief executive Howard Kirby said in a statement.
Teltrend on Thursday reported third quarter net earnings of $0.37 a share compared with $0.46 a share last year.
Kirby said sales and earnings so far this year have not met the company's expectations, but certain segments are showing strong results.
The company's objectives for the next six to nine months include expanding its markets beyond the regional Bell operating companies (RBOCs).

"While the...RBOCs will continue to be our first priority, it's clear to us that we need to expand our sales efforts," Kirby said, citing long-distance and independent telecommunications companies, as well as international markets.
In the longer term, the company's first priority is to make at least one strategic acquisition to add new technology and distribution channels.
"Our cash balance keeps building up," Kirby said. "We have added $7 million to this balance so far this year, and we want to use this cash to accelerate progress toward our strategic objectives."
Teltrend makes local loop products used by telephone companies to provide voice and data services.
